page.title: 03A FARM NEAR COOKSTOWN
page.content: THIS FARMER HAS 87 ACRES-20 ACRES OF{ {WOODLAND}AND THE REST IS{GRASS}FOR HAY.HE GROWS SMALL AMOUNTS OF{BARLEY AS A ROTOTION CROP.THIS YEAR HE HAS NO BARLEY.{HE HAS 32 COWS,A BULL,28CALVES {A HORSE AND 50 SHEEP}.A PEDIGREE COW IS WORTH Â£1000.A CROSS BRED SEMINTAL COW WOULD FETCH Â£450.THIS FARMER FELT DISPLEASED WITH THE GOVERNMENT WHO GAVE NEIGHBOURING FARMERS MORE{GRANTS BECAUSE THEIR FARMS WERE JUST OUTSIDE THE LOWLAND BOUNDARY.HE DOESN'T MILK THE COWS.THE CALVES SUCK THE MILK.HE OWNS{TWO TRACTORS AND A VARIETY OF HAY {MACHINERY.}WHEN HE WAS IN CANADA HE SAW HOW FARMERS SHARED EQUIPMENT.HE THOUGHT THIS WAS A VERY GOOD IDEA AS HE ONLY USES SOME OF HIS MACHINES ONCE OR TWICE A YEAR.HE WORKS THE FARM ALONE BUT EMPLOYS{CASUAL LABOUR}AT TIMES.OUR NOON VISIT FOUND HIM ABOUT TO CUT THE LAWN,HIS FARM WORK DONE.
